Package uk.ac.manchester.spinnaker.connections

Class UDPConnection<T>

java.lang.Object
uk.ac.manchester.spinnaker.connections.UDPConnection<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The Java type of message received on this connection.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.AutoCloseable, Connection, Listenable<T>, MessageReceiver<T>, SocketHolder
Direct Known Subclasses:
BMPConnection, BootConnection, EIEIOConnection, IPAddressConnection, SDPConnection
public abstract class UDPConnection<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Connection, Listenable<T>
A connection to SpiNNaker over UDP/IPv4.

  • Constructor Details

    • UDPConnection

      public UDPConnection​(java.net.InetAddress localHost, java.lang.Integer localPort, java.net.InetAddress remoteHost, java.lang.Integer remotePort) throws java.io.IOException
      Main constructor, any argument of which could null.

      No default constructors are provided as it would not be possible to disambiguate between ones with only a local host/port like IPAddressConnection and ones with only remote host/port like BMPConnection.

      Parameters:
      localHost - The local host to bind to. If null, it defaults to binding to all interfaces, unless remoteHost is specified, in which case binding is done to the IP address that will be used to send packets.
      localPort - The local port to bind to, 0 (or null) or between 1025 and 65535.
      remoteHost - The remote host name or IP address to send packets to. If null, the socket will be available for listening only, and will throw and exception if used for sending.
      remotePort - The remote port to send packets to. If remoteHost is null, this is ignored. If remoteHost is specified, this must also be specified as non-zero for the connection to allow sending.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If there is an error setting up the communication channel

    • getRemoteIPAddress

      public final java.net.InetAddress getRemoteIPAddress()
      Specified by:
      getRemoteIPAddress in interface SocketHolder
      Returns:
      The remote IP address to which the connection is connected, or null if it is not connected.

    • getRemotePort

      public final int getRemotePort()
      Specified by:
      getRemotePort in interface SocketHolder
      Returns:
      The remote port to which the connection is connected, or zero if it is not connected.

    • receive

      public final java.nio.ByteBuffer receive​(java.lang.Integer timeout) throws java.net.SocketTimeoutException, java.io.IOException
      Receive data from the connection.
      Parameters:
      timeout - The timeout in milliseconds, or null to wait forever
      Returns:
      The data received, in a little-endian buffer
      Throws:
      java.net.SocketTimeoutException - If a timeout occurs before any data is received
      java.io.EOFException - If the connection is closed
      java.io.IOException - If an error occurs receiving the data

    • receiveWithAddress

      public final java.net.DatagramPacket receiveWithAddress​(java.lang.Integer timeout) throws java.net.SocketTimeoutException, java.io.IOException
      Receive data from the connection along with the address where the data was received from.
      Parameters:
      timeout - The timeout in milliseconds, or null to wait forever
      Returns:
      The datagram packet received
      Throws:
      java.net.SocketTimeoutException - If a timeout occurs before any data is received
      java.io.EOFException - If the connection is closed
      java.io.IOException - If an error occurs receiving the data

      Parameters:

      Throws:

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Description copied from interface: Connection
      Determines if the medium is connected at this point in time. Connected media are not closed. Disconnected media might not be open.
      Specified by:
      isConnected in interface Connection
      Returns:
      true if the medium is connected, false otherwise

      public boolean isClosed()
      Description copied from interface: Connection
      Determines if the medium is closed at this point in time. Closed media are not connected. Open media might not be connected.
      Specified by:
      isClosed in interface Connection
      Returns:

    • isReadyToReceive

      public final boolean isReadyToReceive​(java.lang.Integer timeout) throws java.io.IOException
      Description copied from interface: Listenable
      Determines if there is a message available to be received without blocking. This method may block until the timeout given.
      Specified by:
      isReadyToReceive in interface Listenable<T>
      Parameters:
      timeout - How long to wait, in milliseconds; if zero or null, a non-blocking poll is performed.
      Returns:
      true when there is a message waiting to be received
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If anything goes wrong, e.g., if the socket is closed under our feet.

    • sendPortTriggerMessage

      public final void sendPortTriggerMessage​(java.net.InetAddress host) throws java.io.IOException
      Sends a port trigger message using a connection to (hopefully) open a port in a NAT and/or firewall to allow incoming packets to be received.
      Parameters:
      host - The address of the SpiNNaker board to which the message should be sent
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If anything goes wrong
